studies.title: Effects of Dietary Taurine-Containing Jelly Supplementation on Academic-Related Characteristics and Academic Achievement in Korean College Entrance Examinees: A Pilot Study.
studies.notes: The study suggests a positive effect of taurine supplementation on academic-related characteristics, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Effects of Dietary Taurine-Containing Jelly Supplementation on Academic-Related Characteristics and Academic Achievement in Korean College Entrance Examinees: A Pilot Study.
studies.notes: The study suggests a positive effect of taurine supplementation on academic-related characteristics, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Effects of N-acetylcysteine on systemic lupus erythematosus disease activity and its associated complications: a randomized double-blind clinical trial study.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant decrease in disease activity scores, indicating a beneficial effect of NAC.

studies.title: Effect of perioperative magnesium sulfate on neurological outcome in neurosurgical patients: a randomized double-blind controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed macroscopic improvement in MRI parameters and better neuropsychological test scores in the magnesium group, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Safety and efficacy of N-acetylcysteine (NAC) as an adjunct to standard treatment in patients with acute ischemic stroke: a randomized controlled pilot trial (NACTLYS).
studies.notes: The study showed a slightly improved early neurological outcome with NAC, indicating a potential benefit despite no significant differences in safety profiles.

studies.title: Efficacy of Acetylcysteine and Selenium in Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage Patients: A Prospective, Multicenter, Single Blind Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study showed a significant reduction in ICU stay but no beneficial effects on radiological outcomes, indicating mixed results.

studies.title: L-theanine and caffeine improve task switching but not intersensory attention or subjective alertness.
studies.notes: The study shows a significant improvement in attention on a switch task, indicating a benefit from the combination of L-Theanine and caffeine.

studies.title: The effects of lutein and zeaxanthin on resting state functional connectivity in older Caucasian adults: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed increased inter-network connectivity, contrary to expectations, indicating mixed outcomes regarding the effects of lutein on brain function.

studies.title: A Combination of Essential Fatty Acids, Panax Ginseng Extract, and Green Tea Catechins Modifies Brain fMRI Signals in Healthy Older Adults.
studies.notes: The study suggests cognitive improvements and brain activation changes, but lacks significant differences compared to placebo, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: Impact of L-theanine and L-tyrosine on markers of stress and cognitive performance in response to a virtual reality based active shooter training drill.
studies.notes: The study found no impact on stress markers but indicated a potential benefit in cognitive performance, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: A Combination of Essential Fatty Acids, Panax Ginseng Extract, and Green Tea Catechins Modifies Brain fMRI Signals in Healthy Older Adults.
studies.notes: The study suggests cognitive improvements and brain activation changes, but lacks significant differences compared to placebo, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: The effects of lutein and zeaxanthin on resting state functional connectivity in older Caucasian adults: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed increased inter-network connectivity, contrary to expectations, indicating mixed outcomes regarding the effects of lutein on brain function.

studies.title: The effects of lutein and zeaxanthin on resting state functional connectivity in older Caucasian adults: a randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed increased inter-network connectivity, contrary to expectations, indicating mixed outcomes regarding the effects of zeaxanthin on brain function.

studies.title: Comparative study of choline alfoscerate as a combination therapy with donepezil: A mixed double-blind randomized controlled and open-label observation trial.
studies.notes: The study shows cognitive improvement with choline alfoscerate in patients with cognitive decline, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Intake of Docosahexaenoic Acid-Enriched Milk Beverage Prevents Age-Related Cognitive Decline and Decreases Serum Bone Resorption Marker Levels.
studies.notes: The study shows that DHA intake prevents cognitive decline and may benefit bone health, indicating a positive outcome.

studies.title: Acute Alpha-Glycerylphosphorylcholine Supplementation Enhances Cognitive Performance in Healthy Men.
studies.notes: The study found significant improvements in cognitive performance, indicating a benefit from Alpha-GPC supplementation.

studies.title: Effects of Beetroot Juice Supplementation on Cognitive Function, Aerobic and Anaerobic Performances of Trained Male Taekwondo Athletes: A Pilot Study.
studies.notes: Cognitive function improved with BJ-400, but no significant differences in performance outcomes were observed.

studies.title: Acute Inositol-Stabilized Arginine Silicate Improves Cognitive Outcomes in Healthy Adults.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in cognitive outcomes, indicating a beneficial effect of the supplement.

studies.title: Effects of Inositol-Enhanced Bonded Arginine Silicate Ingestion on Cognitive and Executive Function in Gamers.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive tasks after ingestion of ASI + I, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Effect of L-theanine on sensorimotor gating in healthy human subjects.
studies.notes: The study found that 200 mg and 400 mg of L-theanine significantly increased sensorimotor gating, indicating a benefit in this context.

studies.title: Effect of single or combined caffeine and L-Theanine supplementation on shooting and cognitive performance in elite curling athletes: a double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in both shooting and cognitive performance with the combined intake of L-Theanine and caffeine compared to placebo and single supplement use.

studies.title: Acute Effects of Naturally Occurring Guayusa Tea and Nordic Lion's Mane Extracts on Cognitive Performance.
studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvements in cognitive performance and subjective cognitive indices with Lion's Mane, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Effects of a Lutein and Zeaxanthin Intervention on Cognitive Function: A Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled Trial of Younger Healthy Adults.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive function metrics, indicating a beneficial effect of lutein supplementation.

studies.title: Acute, dose-dependent cognitive effects of Ginkgo biloba, Panax ginseng and their combination in healthy young volunteers: differential interactions with cognitive demand.
studies.notes: The study shows a dose-dependent improvement in cognitive performance, indicating a benefit from Panax ginseng.

studies.title: Effects of a Lutein and Zeaxanthin Intervention on Cognitive Function: A Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled Trial of Younger Healthy Adults.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive function metrics, indicating a beneficial effect of zeaxanthin supplementation.

studies.title: Creatine with guanidinoacetic acid improves prefrontal brain oxygenation before, during, and after a cognitive task: A randomized controlled pilot trial.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in oxygen saturation, indicating a beneficial effect of creatine supplementation.

studies.title: The Acute and Chronic Effects of Lion's Mane Mushroom Supplementation on Cognitive Function, Stress and Mood in Young Adults: A Double-Blind, Parallel Groups, Pilot Study.
studies.notes: The study suggests potential benefits in cognitive performance and stress reduction, but also notes limited negative findings and a small sample size, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.title: Acute and Repeated Ashwagandha Supplementation Improves Markers of Cognitive Function and Mood.

studies.notes: The study shows that ashwagandha supplementation improves cognitive function and mood, indicating a beneficial outcome.

studies.title: Improvement of Executive Function after Short-Term Administration of an Antioxidants Mix Containing Bacopa, Lycopene, Astaxanthin and Vitamin B12: The BLAtwelve Study.
studies.notes: The study shows significant improvement in cognitive function, indicating a benefit from the antioxidant mix including astaxanthin.

studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in cognitive functions, indicating a benefit from astaxanthin supplementation.

studies.notes: The study showed some improvement in cognitive performance parameters but no significant effect on overall cognitive performance score or sleep quality, indicating mixed outcomes.

studies.title: Acute effects of a chewable beetroot-based supplement on cognitive performance: a double-blind randomized placebo-controlled crossover clinical trial.
studies.notes: The study found significant improvements in cognitive functions, indicating a beneficial effect of the beetroot supplement.

studies.title: Caloric Restriction (CR) Plus High-Nitrate Beetroot Juice Does Not Amplify CR-Induced Metabolic Adaptation and Improves Vascular and Cognitive Functions in Overweight Adults: A 14-Day Pilot Randomised Trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that combining caloric restriction with beetroot juice improves vascular and cognitive functions, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: Role of Î²-Alanine Supplementation on Cognitive Function, Mood, and Physical Function in Older Adults; Double-Blind Randomized Controlled Study.
studies.notes: The study showed significant improvements in cognitive function and a decrease in depression scores for participants with baseline cognitive impairment, indicating a benefit from Î²-alanine supplementation.

studies.title: Î²-Alanine supplementation improves fractional anisotropy scores in the hippocampus and amygdala in 60-80-year-old men and women.
studies.notes: The study shows a benefit in cognitive function as indicated by improved fractional anisotropy scores in brain regions associated with cognition.

studies.title: Î²-Alanine supplementation increased physical performance and improved executive function following endurance exercise in middle aged individuals.
studies.notes: The study shows that beta-alanine supplementation improved exercise capacity and executive function, indicating a benefit.

studies.title: The effect of Boswellia Serrata on neurorecovery following diffuse axonal injury.
studies.notes: The study suggests no significant effect on general outcomes but indicates potential cognitive improvement, leading to a mixed outcome classification.

studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant improvement in cognitive function in patients with TBI who received K-Vieâ¢ compared to placebo.

studies.title: Effect of Treatment of the Cholinergic Precursor Choline Alphoscerate in Mild Cognitive Dysfunction: A Randomized Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: The study aims to assess the efficacy of choline alphoscerate in stabilizing or slowing cognitive decline, indicating a potential benefit.

studies.title: Effects of egg yolk choline intake on cognitive functions and plasma choline levels in healthy middle-aged and older Japanese: a randomized double-blinded placebo-controlled parallel-group study.
studies.notes: The study showed improvement in verbal memory but also lower scores in some cognitive tests, indicating mixed outcomes.

studies.title: [Efficacy and safety of choline alfoscerate in the preventive therapy of dementia in elderly patients with Mild Cognitive Impairment: a three-year prospective comparative study].
studies.notes: The study shows a significant reduction in cognitive deficits and dementia conversion rates in the therapeutic group, indicating a benefit from the treatment.

studies.title: Effects of choline alfoscerate on cognitive function and quality of life in type 2 diabetes: A double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study showed a significant improvement in cognitive function and quality of life at 12 months, indicating a benefit from choline alfoscerate treatment.

studies.title: Efficacy and safety of choline alphoscerate for amnestic mild cognitive impairment: a randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial.

studies.title: The Effect of Creatine Nitrate and Caffeine Individually or Combined on Exercise Performance and Cognitive Function: A Randomized, Crossover, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: Cognitive function improved with co-ingestion, but no significant enhancements in exercise performance were observed.

studies.title: Baseline Findings of PreventE4: A Double-Blind Placebo Controlled Clinical Trial Testing High Dose DHA in APOE4 Carriers before the Onset of Dementia.
studies.notes: The study aims to assess the effects of DHA on cognitive function and brain imaging biomarkers, but the outcomes are not definitively beneficial or harmful based on the abstract.

studies.notes: The study shows significant improvements in cognitive function for MCI patients, indicating a benefit from the supplementation.

studies.notes: The study demonstrated significant cognitive improvements in participants with mild cognitive impairment, indicating a beneficial effect of DHA supplementation.

studies.title: Effects of Folic Acid Combined with DHA Supplementation on Cognitive Function and Amyloid-Î²-Related Biomarkers in Older Adults with Mild Cognitive Impairment by a Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.
studies.notes: DHA improved cognitive function and reduced amyloid-Î² levels, indicating a beneficial effect.

studies.title: Baseline-dependent effect of dopamine's precursor L-tyrosine on working memory gating but not updating.
studies.notes: The study shows mixed outcomes where low-performing subjects improved while high-performing subjects were impaired, indicating a complex relationship between L-tyrosine and working memory performance.

studies.title: Effects of l-Tyrosine on working memory and inhibitory control are determined by DRD2 genotypes: A randomized controlled trial.
studies.notes: The study shows that L-Tyrosine supplementation has beneficial effects on cognitive functions, specifically working memory and inhibitory control, particularly in individuals with certain DRD2 genotypes.

studies.notes: The study shows a significant improvement in working memory in the intervention group compared to the placebo group.

studies.title: Modulation of mood and cognitive performance following acute administration of Melissa officinalis (lemon balm).

studies.title: Modulation of mood and cognitive performance following acute administration of single doses of Melissa officinalis (Lemon balm) with human CNS nicotinic and muscarinic receptor-binding properties.
studies.notes: The study showed improved cognitive performance and mood with the highest dose of Lemon Balm, indicating a beneficial effect.
